movie_title: Is life meaningless? And other absurd questions -  Nina Medvinskaya
introduction: Dive into Albert Camusâ€™ philosophy of the absurd, and explore the question: if the world is meaningl

vocabulary.definition: in low spirits from loss of hope or courage
vocabulary.example: After failing the exam, she felt despondent and didn't want to talk to anyone.

vocabulary.definition: a philosophical theory that emphasizes the existence of the individual person as a free and responsible agent
vocabulary.example: The novel delves into themes of existentialism, questioning the purpose of human existence.

vocabulary.definition: not able to exist or work together because of basic differences
vocabulary.example: Their personalities were so incompatible that they often ended up arguing.

vocabulary.definition: the state of being isolated or estranged from a group or activity to which one should belong or in which one should be involved
vocabulary.example: His constant criticism led to his alienation from the rest of the team.

vocabulary.definition: real and exactly what it appears to be; not artificial
vocabulary.example: She showed genuine concern for her friend's well-being during tough times.

vocabulary.definition: incapable of producing any useful result; pointless
vocabulary.example: Despite their efforts, the search for a solution seemed futile.
